regroup.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to form a group again in order to be more effective, or to make people do this
regroup.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The Allies regrouped and launched a new attack.
The Russians retreated, needing to regroup their forces.
regroup.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to stop and think about something, so that you can start to do something again in a better way
regroup.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I paused for a minute to regroup.
